trans-unit.source: Represents a cell in the rendered table of a tabular ASP.NET data-bound control, such as <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> class is a strongly typed <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell> class that represents a cell in ASP.NET data-bound controls that render their contents in a tabular layout, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> object controls how the cell is rendered by applying styles to the cell.
You can access the containing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell.ContainingField%2A> property.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> class, setting the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object as the cell's container.
This constructor uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag?displayProperty=fullName> element defined by its base class to render the cell.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object passed in the `containingField` parameter is used to determine whether to show headers and what styles to apply to the cell when it is rendered.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> that contains the current cell.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> class, setting the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object as the cell's container.
The `tagKey` parameter is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> base class constructor, and controls the HTML tag that is emitted by the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> passed in the `containingField` parameter is used to determine whether to show headers and what styles to apply to the cell when it is rendered.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> that specifies the HTML tag to render for the cell.
The default tag used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> class is <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag.Td"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> that contains the current cell.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object that contains the current cell.

The content rendering for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> object might be affected by the various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> properties of the containing field, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ItemStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ControlStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ShowHeader%2A>.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> that contains the current cell, or `null`, if no <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> is passed to the class constructor.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the control validates client input.
`true` if the control validates client input; otherwise, `false`.
